title: Acts Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Acts chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Acts Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Acts Chapter 2.

questions.question: What event is described at the beginning of Acts Chapter 2?
questions.correctAnswer: The day of Pentecost
questions.explanation: Acts 2:1 states, 'And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.'

questions.question: What sudden sound came from heaven in Acts 2?
questions.correctAnswer: A rushing mighty wind
questions.explanation: Acts 2:2 explains, 'And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind.'

questions.question: What appeared and sat upon each of the disciples in Acts 2?
options: Cloven tongues like as of fire
questions.correctAnswer: Cloven tongues like as of fire
questions.explanation: Acts 2:3 states, 'And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.'

questions.question: What did the disciples begin to do after being filled with the Holy Ghost?
questions.correctAnswer: Speak with other tongues
questions.explanation: Acts 2:4 says, 'And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues.'

questions.question: Where were the Jews dwelling who heard the disciples speaking in their own languages?
questions.correctAnswer: Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Acts 2:5 mentions, 'And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.'

questions.question: What was the reaction of the multitude when they heard the disciples speak in their own languages?
questions.correctAnswer: They were confounded and amazed
questions.explanation: Acts 2:6-7 explains that the multitude were confounded and amazed because every man heard them speak in his own tongue.

questions.question: Which of the following groups is NOT mentioned among those present in Acts 2:9-11?
questions.correctAnswer: Greeks
questions.explanation: Acts 2:9-11 lists Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and others, but does not mention Greeks explicitly.

questions.question: What accusation did some make about the disciples in Acts 2:13?
options: They are full of new wine
questions.correctAnswer: They are full of new wine
questions.explanation: Acts 2:13 states, 'Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.'

questions.question: Who stood up and addressed the crowd in Acts 2?
questions.correctAnswer: Peter
questions.explanation: Acts 2:14 records, 'But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice.'

questions.question: According to Peter in Acts 2:16-17, who prophesied about the outpouring of the Spirit?
questions.correctAnswer: The prophet Joel
questions.explanation: Acts 2:16 states, 'But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel.'

questions.question: True or False: Acts 2:21 says that whoever calls on the name of the Lord shall be condemned.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 2:21 says, 'whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved,' not condemned.

questions.question: True or False: Peter declared that Jesus was raised up by God after being crucified.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 2:24 says, 'Whom God hath raised up,' referring to Jesus after crucifixion.

questions.question: True or False: According to Acts 2:36, God made Jesus both Lord and Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 2:36 states, 'God hath made that same Jesus... both Lord and Christ.'

questions.question: Complete this verse from Acts 2:38: 'Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: sins
questions.explanation: Acts 2:38 says, 'be baptized... for the remission of sins.'

questions.question: According to Acts 2:41, about how many souls were added to the church on the day of Pentecost?
questions.correctAnswer: About three thousand
questions.explanation: Acts 2:41 states, 'there were added unto them about three thousand souls.'

medium.title: Acts Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Acts Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear and uncertainty about witnessing to others. Based on Acts 2, what biblical truth would you share about the source of boldness in evangelism?
options: They were filled with the Holy Ghost and spoke as the Spirit gave them utterance
They relied on their own wisdom and strength to speak
They avoided speaking to strangers about their faith
They only preached to people from their own nation
questions.correctAnswer: They were filled with the Holy Ghost and spoke as the Spirit gave them utterance
questions.explanation: Acts 2:4 shows that the believers were filled with the Holy Ghost and spoke in other tongues as the Spirit enabled them, highlighting reliance on the Holy Spirit for boldness. This is reinforced by Peter's sermon (Acts 2:14-15) where the Spirit's work is central to their witness.

questions.question: How does Acts 2 teach us about the importance of repentance and baptism in the Christian life when responding to the Gospel?
options: Repent and be baptized for the remission of sins and receive the Holy Ghost
Just believe without any outward expression
Ignore repentance and focus only on good works
questions.correctAnswer: Repent and be baptized for the remission of sins and receive the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Peter instructs in Acts 2:38 that repentance and baptism in Jesus’ name lead to forgiveness of sins and receiving the Holy Ghost, showing obedience to God’s Word as essential steps in salvation and spiritual growth.

questions.question: A believer asks how to cultivate fellowship and unity in their local church. What example from Acts 2 would you share?
options: They continued steadfastly in apostles' doctrine, fellowship, breaking of bread, and prayers
They met only occasionally without shared meals or prayers
They kept possessions private and avoided sharing
They focused solely on individual Bible study
questions.correctAnswer: They continued steadfastly in apostles' doctrine, fellowship, breaking of bread, and prayers
questions.explanation: Acts 2:42 describes the early church’s commitment to learning, fellowship, sharing meals, and prayer as foundations for unity and spiritual growth, emphasizing the role of community disciplines.

questions.question: How does Acts 2 illustrate the biblical principle of generosity and serving others in the church community?
options: They sold possessions and distributed to those in need
They kept their goods for personal gain
They competed for resources within the church
questions.correctAnswer: They sold possessions and distributed to those in need
questions.explanation: Acts 2:44-45 shows believers sharing all things in common and selling possessions to meet others’ needs, demonstrating generosity, stewardship, and love in practical action.

questions.question: What does Acts 2 teach about the attitude believers should have towards prayer and daily devotion?
options: They were daily continuing with one accord in the temple, praying and breaking bread
They prayed only once a week
They neglected prayer and focused on work only
questions.correctAnswer: They were daily continuing with one accord in the temple, praying and breaking bread
questions.explanation: Acts 2:46 highlights the believers’ daily devotion to communal worship, prayer, and fellowship, underscoring persistence and unity in spiritual disciplines.

questions.question: A new believer wonders how to be assured of salvation according to Acts 2. What key truth would you share?
options: Whoever calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved
Salvation depends on good works only
Salvation is by human effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved
questions.explanation: Acts 2:21 teaches salvation is available to all who call on the Lord, emphasizing faith and trust in God’s promise as the basis for assurance.

questions.question: How does Peter’s message in Acts 2 instruct believers about trusting God’s sovereign plan in trials, such as persecution or rejection?
options: Jesus was delivered by God’s foreknowledge and crucified, but God raised Him up
God abandoned Jesus in His trial
Jesus’ suffering was a mistake with no purpose
Believers should avoid suffering at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus was delivered by God’s foreknowledge and crucified, but God raised Him up
questions.explanation: Acts 2:23-24 explains that Jesus’ death was according to God’s determined plan, and His resurrection shows God’s victory, encouraging believers to trust God even in hardship.

questions.question: True or False: According to Acts 2, the early church experienced fear and amazement at the signs and wonders performed by the apostles.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 2:43 states that fear came upon every soul and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles, showing reverence and awe in the early church.

questions.question: According to Acts 2, how is the gift of the Holy Ghost promised and received?
options: It is received after repentance and baptism in Jesus’ name
It is given only to the apostles
It is only for those who speak in tongues
questions.correctAnswer: It is received after repentance and baptism in Jesus’ name
questions.explanation: Acts 2:38-39 explains that repentance and baptism lead to receiving the Holy Ghost, which is also promised to children and all whom God calls, emphasizing obedience and faith.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with contentment and gratitude. What example from Acts 2 encourages a thankful and joyful heart?
options: They ate their meat with gladness and singleness of heart, praising God
They focused on what they lacked and complained
questions.correctAnswer: They ate their meat with gladness and singleness of heart, praising God
questions.explanation: Acts 2:46-47 describes believers sharing meals joyfully and praising God, showing contentment and gratitude as key attitudes in community life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Peter said, 'Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of _______ Christ for the remission of sins.'
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus
questions.explanation: Acts 2:38 clearly states baptism is in the name of Jesus Christ for remission of sins, emphasizing faith in Christ alone for salvation.

questions.question: How does the passage in Acts 2 demonstrate the importance of humility and recognizing Jesus as Lord and Christ?
options: God made Jesus both Lord and Christ, whom the people crucified
Jesus was just a good teacher with no divine role
Jesus’ lordship is a secret not to be proclaimed
Jesus was only a prophet without power
questions.correctAnswer: God made Jesus both Lord and Christ, whom the people crucified
questions.explanation: Acts 2:36 declares Jesus as Lord and Christ, emphasizing humility in recognizing His authority despite past rejection and crucifixion by the people.

questions.question: What does Acts 2 teach about the role of prophecy, visions, and dreams in the last days?
options: God will pour out His Spirit so sons and daughters prophesy, young men see visions, and old men dream dreams
Prophecy and dreams will cease entirely
Visions are unreliable and should be ignored
questions.correctAnswer: God will pour out His Spirit so sons and daughters prophesy, young men see visions, and old men dream dreams
questions.explanation: Acts 2:17-18 quotes Joel’s prophecy about the Spirit’s outpouring leading to prophecy and visions among all believers, encouraging openness to God’s work through His Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: According to Acts 2, the believers shared all things in common and showed integrity by meeting each other's needs.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 2:44-45 shows the early church’s commitment to sharing possessions and providing for one another, demonstrating honesty, integrity, and love in community life.

questions.question: A fellow believer is facing temptation to isolate from the church during trials. What practical teaching from Acts 2 encourages perseverance through fellowship?
options: They continued daily with one accord in the temple and breaking bread from house to house
They abandoned the temple and met alone
They stopped eating together to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: They continued daily with one accord in the temple and breaking bread from house to house
questions.explanation: Acts 2:46 emphasizes daily, united fellowship and communal meals, showing perseverance through unity and shared devotion even in difficult times.

hard.title: Acts Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Acts Chapter 2.

questions.question: What Old Testament prophet does Peter quote to explain the outpouring of the Spirit at Pentecost?
questions.correctAnswer: Joel
questions.explanation: Peter explicitly cites the prophet Joel to explain the Spirit's outpouring in Acts 2:16-18, linking the event to Joel's prophecy about the last days.

questions.question: In Acts 2, what phenomenon accompanied the coming of the Holy Spirit that symbolized divine presence and purification?
options: Cloven tongues like as of fire
questions.correctAnswer: Cloven tongues like as of fire
questions.explanation: Acts 2:3 describes 'cloven tongues like as of fire' that appeared and rested on each person, symbolizing the purifying presence of the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the crowd when they heard the apostles speaking in their own languages?
options: They accused the apostles of blasphemy
questions.correctAnswer: They were amazed and marvelled
questions.explanation: Acts 2:7 states the crowd was amazed and marveled because they heard Galileans speaking in their native tongues, highlighting the miraculous nature of the event.

questions.question: Which groups of people are specifically mentioned as being present in Jerusalem during Pentecost in Acts 2?
options: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and dwellers in Mesopotamia
questions.correctAnswer: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and dwellers in Mesopotamia
questions.explanation: Acts 2:9 lists Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and others dwelling in Mesopotamia among those present, emphasizing the diverse international audience.

questions.question: Peter’s speech in Acts 2 includes a typological reference to which Old Testament figure to affirm Jesus’ resurrection?
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: Peter refers to David's prophecy concerning the Messiah’s resurrection in Acts 2:25-31, using David as a typological figure pointing to Christ.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'it is but the third hour of the day' in Peter's defense against the accusation of drunkenness?
options: It shows the event happened mid-morning when people would not be drunk
It refers to a Jewish festival time
It is the hour for daily sacrifice
It indicates the start of the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the event happened mid-morning when people would not be drunk
questions.explanation: In Acts 2:15, Peter explains it was the third hour (about 9 a.m.), when people would not normally be drunk, refuting the accusation of intoxication.

questions.question: How does Acts 2:21 reflect a major theme in both Old and New Testament salvation theology?
options: Whoever calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved
questions.explanation: Acts 2:21 echoes Joel 2:32 and emphasizes the universal offer of salvation through calling on the Lord, a central theme throughout Scripture.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used in Peter's speech when he contrasts Jesus' death and resurrection with David's prophetic words?
questions.correctAnswer: Typology
questions.explanation: Peter uses typology in Acts 2:25-31, interpreting David’s words as a foreshadowing of Christ’s resurrection, showing fulfillment in Jesus.

questions.question: Which phrase best describes the community life of the early believers as described in Acts 2:44-45?
options: All that believed were together and had all things common
They focused solely on temple sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: All that believed were together and had all things common
questions.explanation: Acts 2:44-45 depict a communal lifestyle where believers shared possessions and met the needs of others, reflecting early Christian fellowship.

questions.question: True or False: According to Acts 2, the Holy Spirit's outpouring was limited only to the apostles present in the upper room.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 2:17-18 indicates the Spirit would be poured out on all flesh, including sons, daughters, servants, and handmaidens, not just the apostles.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'rushing mighty wind' mentioned in Acts 2:2 in the context of ancient Near Eastern symbolism?
options: It symbolizes God's powerful presence and creative Spirit
It signifies the coming of a military army
It is a metaphor for chaos and destruction
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God's powerful presence and creative Spirit
questions.explanation: The 'rushing mighty wind' in Acts 2:2 echoes God's creative Spirit in Genesis 1:2, symbolizing divine power and presence in the new creation of the Church.

questions.question: How does the concept of 'speaking in other tongues' in Acts 2:4 function theologically in relation to the Tower of Babel narrative?
options: It reverses the confusion of languages by enabling understanding
It excludes non-Jews from the community
It represents a new language only for apostles
questions.correctAnswer: It reverses the confusion of languages by enabling understanding
questions.explanation: Acts 2:4-6 shows the Spirit enables apostles to speak various tongues, reversing Babel's confusion by promoting unity and understanding among diverse peoples.

questions.question: Which theme in Acts 2 is foreshadowed by the mention of blood, fire, and vapour of smoke in verse 19, and later fully developed in the Book of Revelation?
questions.correctAnswer: Apocalyptic judgment
questions.explanation: Acts 2:19’s signs of blood, fire, and smoke foreshadow apocalyptic imagery later expanded in Revelation, relating to end-time judgment and divine intervention.

questions.question: What historical-cultural significance does the mention of 'proselytes' alongside Jews in Acts 2:10 have for understanding the early Church's audience?
options: It shows the audience included Gentile converts to Judaism
It refers to Roman citizens only
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the audience included Gentile converts to Judaism
questions.explanation: Proselytes were Gentiles who converted to Judaism, indicating the early Church’s message reached both Jews and God-fearing Gentiles, as in Acts 2:10.

questions.question: What is the significance of Peter standing with the eleven apostles when he addresses the crowd in Acts 2:14?
options: It signifies apostolic authority and unity
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies apostolic authority and unity
questions.explanation: Peter standing with the eleven in Acts 2:14 underscores the unified authority of the apostolic witness to the resurrection and the Spirit’s work.

theological.title: Acts Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Acts Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What event marks the fulfillment of the promise of the Holy Spirit being poured out upon all flesh in the last days?
options: The day of Pentecost when the Holy Spirit filled the believers
The birth of Jesus in Bethlehem
The giving of the Law to Moses on Mount Sinai
questions.correctAnswer: The day of Pentecost when the Holy Spirit filled the believers
questions.explanation: Acts 2:1-4 records the coming of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost, fulfilling Joel's prophecy (Acts 2:16-18) about the Spirit being poured out in the last days. This event inaugurates the new covenant era of Spirit-empowered ministry (Joel 2:28-29, John 7:37-39, Ezekiel 36:27).

questions.question: What miraculous sign accompanied the filling of the Holy Spirit on the believers at Pentecost?
options: Cloven tongues like as of fire sat upon each of them
A pillar of cloud by day and fire by night
questions.correctAnswer: Cloven tongues like as of fire sat upon each of them
questions.explanation: Acts 2:3 describes 'cloven tongues like as of fire' appearing and resting on each believer, symbolizing the purifying and empowering presence of the Spirit (Exodus 3:2, Leviticus 9:24, Isaiah 6:6-7). This sign validated the Spirit's arrival.

questions.question: According to Peter's sermon in Acts 2, by whose determinate counsel and foreknowledge was Jesus crucified?
options: The Jewish leaders without God's knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: God's determinate counsel and foreknowledge
questions.explanation: Acts 2:23 teaches that Jesus' crucifixion was according to God's predetermined plan and foreknowledge, emphasizing divine sovereignty in salvation history (Psalm 22:16-18, Isaiah 53:4-6, Luke 24:44-47).

questions.question: What does Peter claim Jesus did after His crucifixion that shows His victory over death?
options: God raised Him up, loosing the pangs of death
He went to the underworld and preached to spirits
He remained dead until the end of the age
questions.correctAnswer: God raised Him up, loosing the pangs of death
questions.explanation: Acts 2:24 affirms that God raised Jesus, defeating death and proving His messianic identity (Psalm 16:10, Romans 6:9, 1 Corinthians 15:3-4, Revelation 1:18). This resurrection is central to Christian hope.

questions.question: How does Peter use the Old Testament prophet David to affirm Jesus' resurrection?
options: David foresaw the resurrection and spoke of the Lord not being abandoned to decay
David predicted the coming of the Messiah only
David wrote about the creation of the world
David prophesied a future earthly kingdom only
questions.correctAnswer: David foresaw the resurrection and spoke of the Lord not being abandoned to decay
questions.explanation: Acts 2:25-31 cites Psalm 16, where David speaks prophetically about the Messiah's resurrection, emphasizing the promise that his body would not see corruption, thus affirming Jesus' resurrection (Psalm 16:8-11, Isaiah 53, Hosea 6:2, Luke 24:39-43).

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus being exalted to the right hand of God according to Peter's sermon?
options: It signifies divine authority and the receiving of the promised Holy Spirit
It means He ascended to heaven to rest
It indicates He is now an angelic being
It shows He retired from active ministry
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies divine authority and the receiving of the promised Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: Acts 2:33-35 reveals that Jesus' exaltation to God's right hand symbolizes His sovereign rule and the sending of the Spirit, fulfilling prophecy and confirming His messianic office (Psalm 110:1, Hebrews 1:3, Ephesians 1:20-22, John 16:7).

questions.question: What does Peter declare about Jesus in relation to the house of Israel in Acts 2?
options: God has made Jesus both Lord and Christ, whom they crucified
Jesus was just a prophet like Moses
Jesus is a teacher from Galilee
questions.correctAnswer: God has made Jesus both Lord and Christ, whom they crucified
questions.explanation: Acts 2:36 clearly states that God has appointed Jesus as both Lord and Christ (Messiah), and despite their role in His crucifixion, He is sovereign, underscoring the fulfillment of messianic promises (Psalm 2:7-9, Isaiah 9:6-7, Daniel 7:13-14, Romans 10:9).

questions.question: What is the response of the people when they hear Peter's message about Jesus?
options: They were pricked in their heart and asked what they should do
They fled in fear and confusion
They demanded a sign from heaven
questions.correctAnswer: They were pricked in their heart and asked what they should do
questions.explanation: Acts 2:37 describes the listeners' conviction and repentance, a key sign of the Spirit's work drawing sinners to salvation (Psalm 51:17, Joel 2:12-13, John 16:8, 2 Corinthians 7:10).

questions.question: What does Peter instruct the crowd to do in order to receive forgiveness and the gift of the Holy Spirit?
options: Repent and be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ
Follow the Mosaic Law without change
questions.correctAnswer: Repent and be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Acts 2:38 commands repentance and baptism in Jesus' name for the remission of sins and receiving the Holy Spirit, signifying new birth and covenant initiation (Mark 1:4-5, Romans 6:3-4, Galatians 3:27, Titus 3:5).

questions.question: To whom is the promise of the Holy Spirit extended according to Peter's sermon?
options: To you, your children, and all who are afar off, as many as the Lord will call
Only to the Jews in Jerusalem
Only to the apostles and elders
Only to those who keep the Law perfectly
questions.correctAnswer: To you, your children, and all who are afar off, as many as the Lord will call
questions.explanation: Acts 2:39 shows the universal scope of the Spirit's promise, including present believers, their descendants, and future believers across the world, highlighting God's inclusive plan of salvation (Isaiah 44:3, Ezekiel 36:26-27, Joel 2:28-29, Galatians 3:14).

questions.question: How many souls were added to the church on the day of Pentecost after Peter's message?
questions.correctAnswer: About three thousand
questions.explanation: Acts 2:41 reports that approximately three thousand people accepted the gospel and were baptized, marking the birth and numerical growth of the early church (Luke 24:47, John 20:22, 1 Corinthians 12:13, Revelation 7:9).

questions.question: What four practices characterized the early believers' fellowship after Pentecost?
options: Apostles' doctrine, fellowship, breaking of bread, and prayers
Temple sacrifices, circumcision, fasting, and pilgrimages
Feasting, idol worship, story-telling, and singing
questions.correctAnswer: Apostles' doctrine, fellowship, breaking of bread, and prayers
questions.explanation: Acts 2:42 describes early Christian communal life centered on teaching, sharing, communion meals, and prayer, foundational to ecclesiology and worship (Deuteronomy 6:6-7, Psalm 122:1, 1 Corinthians 11:23-26, Colossians 3:16).

questions.question: What was the attitude and unity of the believers as described in Acts 2 after Pentecost?
options: They were together with all things common and sold possessions to share with those in need
They separated into exclusive groups and hoarded wealth
They abandoned the community and lived in isolation
They competed for leadership and riches
questions.correctAnswer: They were together with all things common and sold possessions to share with those in need
questions.explanation: Acts 2:44-45 shows the early church's radical unity and generosity, reflecting the kingdom ethic of love and mutual care (Leviticus 25:35-37, Proverbs 19:17, 2 Corinthians 8:13-15, Hebrews 13:16).

questions.question: How did the early Christians worship daily according to Acts 2?
options: Continuing daily with one accord in the temple and breaking bread from house to house
Only attending synagogue services on the Sabbath
Offering animal sacrifices in the temple daily
Engaging solely in private meditation and prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Continuing daily with one accord in the temple and breaking bread from house to house
questions.explanation: Acts 2:46 describes the believers' consistent communal worship both in the temple and homes, emphasizing corporate and familial worship as part of Christian life (Psalm 122:1, Acts 5:42, Matthew 18:20, Hebrews 10:25).

questions.question: What was the result of the early church's devotion and unity as recorded in Acts 2?
options: The Lord added to their number daily those who were being saved
They were persecuted and scattered immediately
They became wealthy and powerful politically
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord added to their number daily those who were being saved
questions.explanation: Acts 2:47 affirms God's blessing on the church’s faithfulness by adding new believers daily, demonstrating divine sovereignty in the growth of the kingdom (Psalm 68:6, Isaiah 54:2-3, John 10:16, 1 Corinthians 3:6).
